summary: The federal tax gap—the difference between taxes owed and taxes paid on time—has been a persistent problem for decades. IRS estimated that the tax gap was about $428 billion annually from 2014-2016. IRS can reduce the tax gap in part by enforcing tax laws to collect unpaid taxes.
